Description: Lip sherd with turn to wall of Laconian, probably black-figured pottery kylix; slightly concave lip, top lost; dull cream slip; interior glazed black with traces of one band in added red near top; exterior: reserved except for part of three rays above black band; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.650 and 1886,0401.651. Johnston (2014, 105) notes that the same name is found on other dedications, all of which possibly belong to the same person. See Oxford AN1912.41 and British Museum 1888,0601.421. The sherd is also published in Stibbe, C. 'Lakonische Keramik aus dem Heraion von Samos', Mitteilungen des Deutschen Archäologischen Instituts, Athenische Abteilung 112, 1997, 129-130, pl. 16,1-2. Johnston, A.W. 2014. ‘Naukratis, Aegina and Laconia; some individuals and pottery distribution’, in A. Tsingarida (ed.) Pottery Markets in the Ancient Greek World. Proceedings of the International Symposium held at the Université libre de Bruxelles. Bruxelles. 103-12.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.30) (Phase 1)
